summary: Feature request to improve ApplicationFailure API by using an options object instead of positional parameters. The proposal suggests making the constructor accept a configuration object with optional message, type, retryable (instead of nonRetryable), and cause fields, along with a static helper method for creating non-retryable failures.
userImpact: Improves code readability and reduces confusion when creating ApplicationFailure instances by using named parameters instead of positional arguments.
proposedFix: Change ApplicationFailure constructor to accept an options object with message, type, retryable (positive boolean instead of negated nonRetryable), and cause fields. Add ApplicationFailure.nonRetryable() static helper method.
resolutionDetails: Maintainer decided the API change was too late to implement due to backward compatibility concerns.
keyQuote: It's way too late to change now IMO, can we close this?
